artist: Artist: Formerly attributed to Hans Petzoldt
creditline: The Christina N. and Swan J. Turnblad Memorial Fund
description: Ostrich egg drinking cup with cover surmounted by a standing figure of an antique warrior.
medium: Gilt silver and painted egg shell
text: Once regarded as the work of the German silversmith Hans Petzoldt (1551-1633), this cup and cover are now known to date from the late 19th century. Exotic objects like ostrich eggs were treasured by collectors in the 16th and 17th centuries. In the late 19th century, these rarities were prized so highly that a market for fakes sprang up.
title: Ostrich egg cup and cover
